definition:
Arithmetic progression of length $n$, initial term $a_1$ and common
difference $d$ is the sequence $a_1, a_1+d,a_1+2d,\dotsc,a_1+(n-1)d$.

The sum of terms of an arithmetic progression can be computed using
Gauss’s trick:

We just add the sum with itself written backwards, and the sum of each
of the columns equals to $(2a_1+(n-1)d)$. The sum is then
$$S=\frac{(2a_1+(n-1)d)n}{2}.$$
